The step attribute specifies the legal number intervals for seconds or milliseconds in a time field (does not apply for hours or minutes).
Example: if step="2", legal numbers could be 0, 2, 4, etc.
member.remarks: The step attribute is often used together with the max and min attributes to create a range of legal values.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Validation.InitializeInput(Blazorise.IValidationInput)
member.summary: Initializes the input component with the specified validation input. It performs an initial validation if the mode is set to auto validation and validation on load is enabled.
member.param: The validation input component to initialize.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Validation.InitializeInputPattern``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Initializes or updates the input validation pattern. If the pattern string changes, a new regex pattern is created, and the input is re-validated if applicable.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to validate against the pattern.
member.param: The regex pattern string for validation.
The current value of the input to validate against the new pattern.
member.remarks: This method optimizes performance by avoiding re-instantiation of the regex pattern if it has not changed. It ensures that validation is only re-triggered if the component has been initialized and validation conditions are met.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Validation.InitializeInputExpression``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}})
member.summary: Initializes or updates the input based on a specified expression. This is primarily used for data-annotation validation.
member.typeparam: The type of the model the expression evaluates to.
member.param: The expression used to identify the field for validation.
member.remarks: This method is designed to work with models and edit contexts, allowing for dynamic validation based on expressions. It ensures that validation is only re-triggered if the component has been initialized and validation conditions are met.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Validation.NotifyInputChanged``1(``0,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Notifies that an input's value has changed and optionally re-validates the input.
member.typeparam: The type of the new value.
member.param: The new value of the expression.
Determines whether to use the new value for validation or the current input component's validation value.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: If the edit context is set and a field identifier has been established, this method notifies the edit context of the field change. It then conditionally triggers validation based on the component's mode.

member.summary: Clears all validation statuses.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Validations.NotifyValidationInitialized(Blazorise.IValidation)
member.summary: Notifies the validation system that a new validation component has been initialized and adds it to the list of validations if not already present.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Validations.NotifyValidationRemoved(Blazorise.IValidation)
member.summary: Notifies the validation system that a validation component is being removed and removes it from the list of validations if present.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Validations.NotifyValidationStatusChanged(Blazorise.IValidation)
member.summary: Notifies the validation system that the status of a validation component has changed. This method handles the logic for updating the overall validation status based on the mode (Auto or Manual) and the current validation results.
member.param: The validation component whose status has changed.
member.remarks: In Auto mode, this method triggers the aggregation of validation results and potentially raises a status changed event. It is designed to minimize the number of status changed events by aggregating validation results. Special consideration is needed to ensure that the status changed event is raised only once per validation cycle, even if multiple validations fail.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Validations.Mode
member.summary: Defines the validation mode for validations inside of this container.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Validations.ValidateOnLoad
member.summary: If set to true, and is set to , validation will run automatically on page load.
member.remarks: When validation is placed inside of modal dialog, the behavior is a little different. Modals are by definition always loaded and are always present in the DOM so no loading is ever happening again after the page that contains the modal is first initialized. Their visibility is controlled by display: none; To workaround this, the actual "first load" for modals can be done by re-initializing parameter.

member.name: T:Blazorise.DropdownPositionStrategy
member.summary: Defines the position strategy for the floating component.

member.name: F:Blazorise.DropdownPositionStrategy.Absolute
member.summary: The floating element is positioned relative to its nearest positioned ancestor. With most layouts, this usually requires the browser to do the least work when updating the position.

member.name: F:Blazorise.DropdownPositionStrategy.Fixed
member.summary: The floating element is positioned relative to its nearest containing block (usually the viewport). This is useful when the reference element is also fixed to reduce jumpiness with positioning while scrolling.

member.name: T:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent
member.summary: The align-content property aligns a flex containers lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent.Default
member.summary: Align-content will not be applied.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent.Start
member.summary: Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container.
member.remarks: The cross-start edge of the first line in the flex container is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the flex container, and each subsequent line is placed flush with the preceding line.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent.End
member.summary: Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container.
member.remarks: The cross-end edge of the last line is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the flex container, and each preceding line is placed flush with the subsequent line.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent.Center
member.summary: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container.
member.remarks: The lines in the flex container are placed flush with each other and aligned in the center of the flex container, with equal amounts of space between the cross-start content edge of the flex container and the first line in the flex container, and between the cross-end content edge of the flex container and the last line in the flex container. (If the leftover free-space is negative, the lines will overflow equally in both directions.)

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent.Between
member.summary: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container.
member.remarks: If the leftover free-space is negative or there is only a single flex line in the flex container, this value is identical to flex-start. Otherwise, the cross-start edge of the first line in the flex container is placed flush with the cross-start content edge of the flex container, the cross-end edge of the last line in the flex container is placed flush with the cross-end content edge of the flex container, and the remaining lines in the flex container are distributed so that the spacing between any two adjacent lines is the same.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent.Around
member.summary: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end.
member.remarks: If the leftover free-space is negative this value is identical to center. Otherwise, the lines in the flex container are distributed such that the spacing between any two adjacent lines is the same, and the spacing between the first/last lines and the flex container edges is half the size of the spacing between flex lines.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignContent.Stretch
member.summary: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.
member.remarks: If the leftover free-space is negative, this value is identical to flex-start. Otherwise, the free-space is split equally between all of the lines, increasing their cross size.

member.name: T:Blazorise.FlexAlignItems
member.summary: Defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on the current line.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignItems.Default
member.summary: Align-items will not be applied.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignItems.Start
member.summary: Items are placed at the start of the cross axis. The difference between these is subtle, and is about respecting the flex-direction rules or the writing-mode rules.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignItems.End
member.summary: Items are placed at the end of the cross axis. The difference again is subtle and is about respecting flex-direction rules vs. writing-mode rules.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignItems.Center
member.summary: Items are centered in the cross-axis.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignItems.Baseline
member.summary: Items are aligned such as their baselines align.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignItems.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch to fill the container (still respect min-width/max-width).

member.name: T:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf
member.summary: Allows the default alignment (or the one specified by align-items) to be overridden for individual flex items.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf.Default
member.summary: Align-self will not be applied.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf.Auto
member.summary: Equals to the value specified in the align-items property for the flex container (its the default value).

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf.Start
member.summary: Items are placed at the start of the cross axis. The difference between these is subtle, and is about respecting the flex-direction rules or the writing-mode rules.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf.End
member.summary: Items are placed at the end of the cross axis. The difference again is subtle and is about respecting flex-direction rules vs. writing-mode rules.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf.Center
member.summary: Items are centered in the cross-axis.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf.Baseline
member.summary: Items are aligned such as their baselines align.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexAlignSelf.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch to fill the container (still respect min-width/max-width).

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexDirection.Default

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexDirection.Row
member.summary: The flex container's main-axis is defined to be the same as the text direction. The main-start and main-end points are the same as the content direction.

member.summary: Shrink rule will be applied.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexGrowShrinkSize.Is0

member.name: T:Blazorise.FlexJustifyContent
member.summary: Defines the alignment along the main axis.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexJustifyContent.Default
member.summary: Justify-content will not be applied.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexJustifyContent.Start
member.summary: Items are packed toward the start of the flex-direction.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexJustifyContent.End
member.summary: Items are packed toward the end of the flex-direction.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexJustifyContent.Center
member.summary: Items are centered along the line.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexJustifyContent.Between
member.summary: Items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item on the end line.

member.name: F:Blazorise.FlexJustifyContent.Around
member.summary: Items are evenly distributed in the line with equal space around them. Note that visually the spaces aren't equal, since all the items have equal space on both sides.
member.remarks: The first item will have one unit of space against the container edge, but two units of space between the next item because that next item has its own spacing that applies.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextColor.Black50

member.name: T:Blazorise.TextInputMode
member.summary: Specifies what kind of input mechanism would be most helpful for users entering content.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.None
member.summary: The user agent should not display a virtual keyboard. This keyword is useful for content that renders its own keyboard control.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.Text
member.summary: The user agent should display a virtual keyboard capable of text input in the user's locale.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.Tel
member.summary: The user agent should display a virtual keyboard capable of telephone number input. This should including keys for the digits 0 to 9, the "#" character, and the "*" character. In some locales, this can also include alphabetic mnemonic labels (e.g., in the US, the key labeled "2" is historically also labeled with the letters A, B, and C).

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.Url
member.summary: The user agent should display a virtual keyboard capable of text input in the user's locale, with keys for aiding in the input of URLs, such as that for the "/" and "." characters and for quick input of strings commonly found in domain names such as "www." or ".com".

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.Email
member.summary: The user agent should display a virtual keyboard capable of text input in the user's locale, with keys for aiding in the input of e-mail addresses, such as that for the "@" character and the "." character.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.Numeric
member.summary: The user agent should display a virtual keyboard capable of numeric input. This keyword is useful for PIN entry.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.Decimal
member.summary: The user agent should display a virtual keyboard capable of fractional numeric input. Numeric keys and the format separator for the locale should be shown.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextInputMode.Search
member.summary: The user agent should display a virtual keyboard optimized for search.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextOverflow.Default

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextOverflow.Wrap
member.summary: Text will wrap into a new line when it reaches the end of container.

member.summary: Prevents text from wrapping.

member.name: F:Blazorise.TextOverflow.Truncate

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContent
member.summary: Rule for starting the flex justify-content.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContent.JustifyContent
member.summary: Defines the alignment along the main axis.

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContentPositions
member.summary: Defines all the allowed positions for justify-content rule.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContentPositions.Start
member.summary: Items are packed toward the start of the flex-direction.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContentPositions.End
member.summary: Items are packed toward the end of the flex-direction.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContentPositions.Center
member.summary: Items are centered along the line.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContentPositions.Between
member.summary: Items are evenly distributed in the line; first item is on the start line, last item on the end line.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexJustifyContentPositions.Around
member.summary: Items are evenly distributed in the line with equal space around them. Note that visually the spaces aren't equal, since all the items have equal space on both sides.
member.remarks: The first item will have one unit of space against the container edge, but two units of space between the next item because that next item has its own spacing that applies.

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItems
member.summary: Rule for starting the flex align-items.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItems.AlignItems
member.summary: Defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on the current line.

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItemsPosition
member.summary: Defines all the allowed positions for align-items rule.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItemsPosition.Start
member.summary: Items are placed at the start of the cross axis. The difference between these is subtle, and is about respecting the flex-direction rules or the writing-mode rules.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItemsPosition.End
member.summary: Items are placed at the end of the cross axis. The difference again is subtle and is about respecting flex-direction rules vs. writing-mode rules.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItemsPosition.Center
member.summary: Items are centered in the cross-axis.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItemsPosition.Baseline
member.summary: Items are aligned such as their baselines align.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignItemsPosition.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch to fill the container (still respect min-width/max-width).

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelf
member.summary: Rule for starting the flex align-self.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelf.AlignSelf
member.summary: Allows the default alignment (or the one specified by align-items) to be overridden for individual flex items.

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelfPosition
member.summary: Defines all the allowed positions for align-self rule.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelfPosition.Auto
member.summary: Equals to the value specified in the align-items property for the flex container (its the default value).

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelfPosition.Start
member.summary: Items are placed at the start of the cross axis. The difference between these is subtle, and is about respecting the flex-direction rules or the writing-mode rules.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelfPosition.End
member.summary: Items are placed at the end of the cross axis. The difference again is subtle and is about respecting flex-direction rules vs. writing-mode rules.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelfPosition.Center
member.summary: Items are centered in the cross-axis.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelfPosition.Baseline
member.summary: Items are aligned such as their baselines align.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignSelfPosition.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch to fill the container (still respect min-width/max-width).

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContent
member.summary: Rule for starting the flex align-content.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContent.AlignContent
member.summary: The align-content property aligns a flex containers lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis.

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContentPosition
member.summary: Defines all the allowed positions for align-content rule.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContentPosition.Start
member.summary: Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container.
member.remarks: The cross-start edge of the first line in the flex container is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the flex container, and each subsequent line is placed flush with the preceding line.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContentPosition.End
member.summary: Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container.
member.remarks: The cross-end edge of the last line is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the flex container, and each preceding line is placed flush with the subsequent line.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContentPosition.Center
member.summary: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container.
member.remarks: The lines in the flex container are placed flush with each other and aligned in the center of the flex container, with equal amounts of space between the cross-start content edge of the flex container and the first line in the flex container, and between the cross-end content edge of the flex container and the last line in the flex container. (If the leftover free-space is negative, the lines will overflow equally in both directions.)

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContentPosition.Between
member.summary: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container.
member.remarks: If the leftover free-space is negative or there is only a single flex line in the flex container, this value is identical to flex-start. Otherwise, the cross-start edge of the first line in the flex container is placed flush with the cross-start content edge of the flex container, the cross-end edge of the last line in the flex container is placed flush with the cross-end content edge of the flex container, and the remaining lines in the flex container are distributed so that the spacing between any two adjacent lines is the same.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContentPosition.Around
member.summary: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end.
member.remarks: If the leftover free-space is negative this value is identical to center. Otherwise, the lines in the flex container are distributed such that the spacing between any two adjacent lines is the same, and the spacing between the first/last lines and the flex container edges is half the size of the spacing between flex lines.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentFlexAlignContentPosition.Stretch
member.summary: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.
member.remarks: If the leftover free-space is negative, this value is identical to flex-start. Otherwise, the free-space is split equally between all of the lines, increasing their cross size.

member.name: T:Blazorise.Flex
member.summary: Set of flex rules to start the build process.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex._
member.summary: Explicitly starts the new set of rules for flex display.
member.remarks: By default all rules use "flex" type but in case someone wants to define it explicitly I have added this option. It is named as "_" because "Flex" cannot be used(Compiler Error CS0542).

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.InlineFlex
member.summary: Starts the new set of rules for inline-flex display.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.Row
member.summary: Default value. The flexible items are displayed horizontally, as a row.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.ReverseRow
member.summary: Same as row, but in reverse order.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.Column
member.summary: The flexible items are displayed vertically, as a column.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.ReverseColumn
member.summary: Same as column, but in reverse order.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.JustifyContent
member.summary: Defines the alignment along the main axis.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.AlignItems
member.summary: Defines the default behavior for how flex items are laid out along the cross axis on the current line.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.AlignSelf
member.summary: Allows the default alignment (or the one specified by align-items) to be overridden for individual flex items.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.AlignContent
member.summary: The align-content property aligns a flex containers lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.Grow
member.summary: Defines the ability for a flex item to grow if necessary. It accepts a unitless value that serves as a proportion. It dictates what amount of the available space inside the flex container the item should take up.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.Shrink
member.summary: This defines the ability for a flex item to shrink if necessary.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.Order
member.summary: Controls the order in which items appear in the flex container.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.Wrap
member.summary: Flex items will wrap onto multiple lines, from top to bottom.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.ReverseWrap
member.summary: Flex items will wrap onto multiple lines from bottom to top.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.NoWrap
member.summary: All flex items will be on one line.

member.name: P:Blazorise.Flex.Fill
member.summary: Force all child items to be equal widths.

member.name: T:Blazorise.IFluentPositionType
member.summary: Type of positions allowed for the fluent position builder.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentPositionType.Static
member.summary: An element is not positioned in any special way; it is always positioned according to the normal flow of the page.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentPositionType.Relative
member.summary: An element is positioned relative to its normal position.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentPositionType.Absolute
member.summary: An element is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor (instead of positioned relative to the viewport, like fixed).

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentPositionType.Fixed
member.summary: An element is positioned relative to the viewport, which means it always stays in the same place even if the page is scrolled. The top, right, bottom, and left properties are used to position the element.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentPositionType.Sticky
member.summary: An element is positioned based on the user's scroll position.

member.summary: The top property affects the vertical position of a positioned element.

member.name: P:Blazorise.IFluentPositionEdgeType.End

member.summary: Defines the element size in pixels (1px = 1/96th of 1in).
member.remarks: Pixels (px) are relative to the viewing device. For low-dpi devices, 1px is one device pixel (dot) of the display. For printers and high resolution screens 1px implies multiple device pixels.
member.returns: Returns the reference.

member.returns: Returns the reference.

member.summary: Defines the element size, relative to the font-size of the element (2em means 2 times the size of the current font).
member.returns: Returns the reference.

member.returns: Returns the reference.

member.summary: Don't call this directly - it gets called by EventCallbackSubscription.

member.name: T:Blazorise.Infrastructure.EventCallbackSubscriber`1
member.summary: Represents a subscriber that may be subscribe to an . The subscription can move between instances over time, and automatically unsubscribes from earlier instances whenever it moves to a new one.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Infrastructure.EventCallbackSubscriber`1.#ctor(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.EventCallback{`0})
member.summary: A default constructor.

member.name: M:Blazorise.Infrastructure.EventCallbackSubscriber`1.SubscribeOrMove(Blazorise.Infrastructure.EventCallbackSubscribable{`0})
member.summary:
Creates a subscription on the , or moves any existing subscription to it by first unsubscribing from the previous .
If the supplied is null, no new subscription will be created, but any existing one will still be unsubscribed.

member.summary: Provides the access to the underline file through the stream.
member.param: Stream to which the upload process if writing.
A cancellation token to signal the cancellation of streaming file data.

member.name: M:Blazorise.IFileEntry.OpenReadStream(System.Int64,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Opens the stream for reading the uploaded file.
member.param:
The maximum number of bytes that can be supplied by the Stream. Defaults to 500 KB.
Calling will throw if the file's size, as specified by is larger than . By default, if the user supplies a file larger than 500 KB, this method will throw an exception.
It is valuable to choose a size limit that corresponds to your use case. If you allow excessively large files, this may result in excessive consumption of memory or disk/database space, depending on what your code does with the supplied .
For Blazor Server in particular, beware of reading the entire stream into a memory buffer unless you have passed a suitably low size limit, since you will be consuming that memory on the server.
A cancellation token to signal the cancellation of streaming file data.
member.exception: Thrown if the file's length exceeds the value.
